summary: This is an email chain from October 9, 2020, discussing the logistics of transferring three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case. The emails coordinate between FBI personnel to ensure the drives are delivered and processed without delay for the SDNY (Southern District of New York), noting the high-level attention the case is receiving.

persons.name: SSA- Forensic Examiner CART/OS-I9 New York
persons.context: The sender of an email in the chain, confirming that an individual named 'is' is handling the hard drive transfer and offering assistance for any issues.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Hard Drive Transfer
events.description: Email correspondence details the plan to obtain and transfer three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case, ensuring no delays for the SDNY.
personsInvolved: SSA- Forensic Examiner CART/OS-I9 New York

keyFacts: Three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case were being transferred on October 9, 2020.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was the intended recipient of the hard drives, indicating ongoing investigative activity.
The email notes 'Given the attention this case is getting from EM', suggesting high-level scrutiny (EM likely refers to Executive Management or a similar entity).
An individual involved is noted as being 'OCONUS' (Outside Continental United States) the following week on this case.
The communication emphasizes avoiding delays due to the sensitive nature of the case.
